top_comments_top.body:
Hello and welcome to r/LifeProTips!

Please help us decide if this post is a good fit for the subreddit by up or downvoting this comment. 

If you think that this is great advice to improve your life, please upvote. If you think this doesn't help you in any way, please downvote. If you don't care, leave it for the others to decide.

It’s hard to go out when you are feeling depressed. But it’s good advice if you can force yourself. A good therapist told me I can do anything for 5 minutes and then reassess if I still feel bad about doing said thing- like going outside. Most of the time 5 turns into 10 turns into 20 and so on.
Bro I just walked in the rain. Best feeling is just looking up into the rain and enjoying life.

Plants indoors too, I have a wall of plants behind the TV monitor I am using. A literal life saver for me at least. It is hard to get depressed when you see happy plants all around you.

TIP: I *swear* by using [these](https://www.amazon.ca/ZAOS-Watering-Probes-Stakes-Roses/dp/B074YSW7HB/ref=sr_1_18?crid=7CT22Q1UCY53&dchild=1&keywords=plant+watering+spikes&qid=1635549400&sprefix=plant+watering+spike%2Caps%2C138&sr=8-18) specific plant watering spikes that are anti gravity through capillary action, not like other 'spikes'. It is a life changer. If you manually watering plants, you are doing it on hard mode (and overwatering is leading cause of death for indoor plants).
This is totally true for me!! When I venture out into the world, it instantly makes me feel better.

top_comments_best.body:
Hello and welcome to r/LifeProTips!

It’s hard to go out when you are feeling depressed. But it’s good advice if you can force yourself. A good therapist told me I can do anything for 5 minutes and then reassess if I still feel bad about doing said thing- like going outside. Most of the time 5 turns into 10 turns into 20 and so on.
This is totally true for me!! When I venture out into the world, it instantly makes me feel better.
Bro I just walked in the rain. Best feeling is just looking up into the rain and enjoying life.
As someone who was full time WFH prior to COVID, the 3$ daily Star Bucks was worth it to see daylight, people, and the hustle and bustle, not to mention the refills.
